translation.en: Things will never be the same without him, huh?
translation.es: Las cosas no serán iguales sin él.

translation.en: Our people, uh...
I know they don't get along that good.
They'll be okay.
Uh, Frankie. I know you don't like me because the commission passed you over.
translation.es: Frankie. Sé que no te caigo bien porque la comisión te ignoró.

translation.en: You being my brother's underboss,
translation.es: Como mano derecha de mi hermano,

translation.en: you think you should have been the next in line. I understand that.
translation.es: crees que debías haberlo sucedido tú. Entiendo.

translation.en: As a matter of fact,
I like you, Aldo.
You're just not qualified to be a boss.
translation.es: Pero no tienes experiencia para ser capitán.

translation.en: You're a bean counter.
You belong on Wall Street, not with us.
translation.es: Debes estar en Wall Street, no aquí con nosotros.

translation.en: What are you trying to say?
Everything's money with you, Aldo.
translation.es: Para ti todo es dinero, Aldo.

translation.en: You got no respect for our thing.
You got no soul.
That's why your brother, Sally Boy, rest in peace,
translation.es: Por eso tu hermano, Sally Boy, que en paz descanse,

translation.en: never gave you more than his taxes to do every year.
translation.es: nunca dejó que te encargaras más que de sus impuestos.

translation.en: Yeah?
Well, I'm the boss now.
translation.es: Pues, ahora el jefe soy yo.

translation.en: And you better make sure your people keep in line.
translation.es: Mejor mantén a raya a tu gente.

translation.en: Don't worry about my people.
translation.es: No te preocupes por mi gente.

translation.en: But you better worry about yours.
[mutters] Yeah.
Hey, boss.
Jimmy, what do you hear, what do you say?
Couple of those FBI guys were in here.
They left a card.
- Oh, yeah? - Golf buddies of yours?
They're trying to convince me my life's in danger.
translation.es: Quieren convencerme de que mi vida corre peligro.

translation.en: [Jimmy] You?
You're the only guy I know whose life isn't in danger.
translation.es: De mis conocidos, solo la tuya no corre peligro.

translation.en: And everybody I know, everybody loves Frankie the Fixer.
translation.es: Y se sabe que todos aman a Frankie el Reparador.

translation.en: Eh, tell me about it.
I'm gonna give you the cocksucker,
but I got some demands.
For starters,
I don't want to relocate in the US.
translation.es: no quiero mudarme dentro de EE. UU.

translation.en: It ain't safe around here no more.
Then what are you thinking? Sun bed in the Bahamas?
translation.es: ¿Qué tienes en mente? ¿Broncearte en Las Bahamas?

translation.en: Nah.
Melanoma's for the old-school wiseguys.
translation.es: El cáncer de piel es para los de antes.

translation.en: I'm thinking Lilyhammer.
Lily what?
[woman] I think it's in Sweden.
Close enough.
Why the fuck would you want to go there?
Didn't you see the Olympics in '94?
It was beautiful.
Clean air, fresh white snow, gorgeous broads,
translation.es: Aire puro, nieve blanca, mujeres preciosas,

translation.en: and best of all, nobody but nobody's gonna be looking for me there.
translation.es: y, lo mejor de todo, nadie me buscará allí.

translation.en: Listen, you give us Aldo Delucci,
and we'll send you to the goddamn North Pole.
translation.es: y te mandamos al jodido Polo Norte.

translation.en: You got a deal.
[woman on radio] Just minutes ago, the district attorney's prime witness,
translation.es: Hace unos minutos, el testigo estrella del fiscal de distrito y ex capo segundo Frank "El Reparador" Tagliano,

translation.en: former underboss Frank "The Fixer" Tagliano,
translation.es: y ex capo segundo Frank "El Reparador" Tagliano,

translation.en: gave a shattering testimony against his boss, Aldo Delucci.
translation.es: prestó un demoledor testimonio contra Aldo Delucci, su jefe.

translation.en: Inside sources say Tagliano is the last person
translation.es: Fuentes internas aseguran que Tagliano era la última persona

translation.en: anyone would have expected to testify.
[man] Now, sports with Mike Mitchell...
Look, here's the file to your new identity,
translation.es: Tu archivo con la nueva identidad.

translation.en: and the address to your new house.
translation.es: El domicilio de tu nuevo hogar.

translation.en: We had to give you a backstory with a Norwegian father.
From now on, you're Giovanni Henriksen. You're a restaurant owner with no criminal record.
translation.es: Eres dueño de un restaurante sin antecedentes penales.

translation.en: [stammers] Hangrinsen?
You couldn't find a more complicated name?
If you get into any, and I mean any trouble with the police,
translation.es: Si tienes cualquier problema con la policía,

translation.en: you are on your own.
Don't worry about a thing.
I'm a brand-new guy over here.
Yeah, right.
[woman speaking Norwegian on headphones] Hello.
How are you?
I am fine.
How about you?
Hi.
My name is Kari.
What is your name?
translation.es: ¿Cómo te llamas? Capítulo nueve: De compras.

translation.en: Chapter Nine: Shopping.
Sorry, we are sold out of bread.
translation.es: Perdón, no quedamos sin pan. No importa.

translation.en: [man 1] Not so good-looking? [man 2] She was at least 30 years old.
translation.es: -¿Que no era linda? -Tenía al menos 30 años.

translation.en: - Could you please turn it down? - [man 1] Like this?
- [older man] Please, turn it off. - [man 1] Jerk!
- Hey. - Give me my cap back.
Give me my cap back.
[in English] Do I have your attention?
Just nod.
Yeah. This is what happens next:
translation.es: Bien. Esto es lo que pasará ahora:

translation.en: You're gonna go out there, you're gonna give the man his hat back,
translation.es: irás a devolverle al hombre su sombrero,

translation.en: and you're gonna shut that shit off. Yes?
- Yes. - Here's your fucking hanky.
Go do the right thing.
- [in Norwegian] Turn the music off. - [music stops]
Sorry.
- Okay? - Okay
- [man 2 mutters insult] - Shut up.
So, straight to the asylum reception center, I take it?
translation.es: Va directo al centro de recepción, ¿no?

translation.en: [in English] Excuse me?
[in Norwegian] Oh, you don't speak Norwegian?
[in English] Uh... Just a little bit.
[in Norwegian] I just thought you looked a little Arab.
translation.es: Me pareció que lucía como un árabe.

translation.en: [in English] You look a little Arabish in the face.
Well, I'm an American.
translation.es: Soy estadounidense. ¿Estadounidense? ¿Qué rayos hace en Lillehammer?

translation.en: [in Norwegian] An American? What the hell are you doing in Lillehammer?
[in English] Tell you the truth, I fell in love with your Olympics.
translation.es: Para ser sincero, me enamoré de sus Olimpiadas.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Ah, those were the days. I wasn't sober until February, 1995.
translation.es: ¡Qué épocas! No recuperé la sobriedad hasta febrero de 1995.

translation.en: [in English] I wasn't sober until one year after.
translation.es: No estuve sobrio hasta un año después.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Okay.
[in English] Here we are.
- That place? - Yep.
[in Norwegian] So, that'll be 273 kroner.
[in English] Are you sure that's the house?
Yes, sir. [in Norwegian] This is it.
[in English] Here you go. Keep the change, all right?
translation.es: Aquí tiene. Quédese con el cambio.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Shit, thanks a lot.
[in English] Welcome to Lillehammer.
This one's for you, Lily.
[man speaking Norwegian on TV] What makes a person seek solitude and a strange religion?
translation.es: ¿Qué hace que una persona busque soledad y una religión extraña?

translation.en: The answer can be found in...
...and again there has been an unwanted guest in the Lillehammer area.
translation.es: ...otra vez hay un visitante no deseado en Lillehammer. El lobo fue visto ayer...

translation.en: The wolf was sighted yesterday...
[in Norwegian] How are you?
How are you?
[in English] What the fuck...
- [in Norwegian] There it is! - [in English] Excuse me?
[in Norwegian] It is my sheep head. It must have fallen out of the bag.
translation.es: Es mi cabeza de oveja. Debe haberse caído de la bolsa.

translation.en: [in English] I'm sorry, I don't understand.
Oh, the sheep head, it's my dinner.
translation.es: La cabeza de oveja... es mi cena.

translation.en: - Oh. You're gonna eat this? - Oh, yeah. It's very good.
translation.es: ¿Va a comer esto? Sí, es muy sabrosa.

translation.en: - Yum! Yum! - [Frank chuckling]
translation.es: Sí, es muy sabrosa. Llegué a creer que debía darle a Johnny Fontane un papel en una película.

translation.en: Well, for a minute there, I thought I was going to have to give Johnny Fontane a movie part.
translation.es: Llegué a creer que debía darle a Johnny Fontane un papel en una película.

translation.en: [chuckles awkwardly] Okay. You must be the new neighbor.
translation.es: Está bien. Ud. debe ser el nuevo vecino.

translation.en: - Laila Hovland. - Hi. Giovanni Hankrensen.
Hankrensen? Is that Indian or...
[stammering] No, it's Henriksen.
My father was Norwegian.
[in Norwegian] He was Norwegian.
So you understand Norwegian?
- [Laila laughing] - [in English] Call me Johnny.
- Johnny. - Oh, you're in the postal service, huh?
[in English] Oh, no. I'm, um, the... lensmann.
I'm chief of police.
[in Norwegian] So, you'll sleep safely here.
- Oh... - [in English] See you around!
[in Norwegian] See you, Johnny!
Okay...
What the fuck?
Fuckin' amateurs.
How are you doing?
- Giovanni Henriksen? - Yes.
So...
You lived in New York all your life?
translation.es: ...¿vivió en Nueva York toda su vida?

translation.en: That's right.
♪ Start spreading the news ♪
[chuckling] I was there once, you know. The Big Apple.
translation.es: Una vez estuve en La Gran Manzana.

translation.en: - That's good. - Yeah.
And you have some background from the restaurant business?
translation.es: ¿Tiene antecedentes en el negocio de los restaurantes?

translation.en: Yeah.
[in Norwegian] There are not many jobs available now.
translation.es: Ahora no hay muchos empleos disponibles.

translation.en: There's not very much here... A delivery job at Dolly Dimple's.
translation.es: No hay... Un empleo de repartidor en Dolly Dimple's.

translation.en: [in English] Pizza delivery.
I had a very successful bar in New York, you know.
translation.es: En Nueva York tenía un bar muy exitoso.

translation.en: So I know all about it.
I just need you to make a few moves so I can get a local license, that's all.
translation.es: Solo mueva influencias para conseguir una licencia.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] We need to have a reality check.
translation.es: Debemos hacer un chequeo de la realidad.

translation.en: [in English] We have to have some reality check here, you know?
translation.es: Hagamos una revisión de la realidad.

translation.en: To start a bar is a very complicated process.
translation.es: Abrir un bar es un trámite muy complicado.

translation.en: Oh, complications. That's what you call it here?
Same thing where I come from.
I brought a little something for that purpose.
Take care of whoever you gotta take care of.
translation.es: Arregle todo lo que haya que arreglar.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Excuse me, but are you attempting to bribe a public official?
translation.es: Disculpe, ¿acaso intenta... sobornar a un servidor público?

translation.en: [in English] No. It's just so everybody can wet their beak a little bit.
translation.es: Solo para que todos se vean beneficiados.

translation.en: - Do you want me to call the police? - What?
translation.es: ¿Quiere que llame a la policía? -¿Qué? -¿Tomo el teléfono

translation.en: Should I pick up the phone and call the police?
translation.es: -¿Qué? -¿Tomo el teléfono y llamo a la policía?

translation.en: Easy, take it easy.
All right, maybe you do things differently here.
translation.es: Quizá aquí las cosas son diferentes.

translation.en: - Yeah. - I apologize.
Okay.
Maybe we should put this on the account for cultural differences?
translation.es: Quizá debamos considerarlo una diferencia cultural.

translation.en: Cultural differences.
[in Norwegian] I think we'll start by enrolling you on a job-seeker course.
translation.es: Lo inscribiré en un curso para buscar empleo.

translation.en: Starts Friday.
You turn up there with a slightly more humble attitude, and we'll start afresh.
translation.es: Tenga una actitud más humilde y empecemos desde cero.

translation.en: - [in English] Blank sheets, okay? - Okay, okay, blank sheets.
translation.es: Borrón y cuenta nueva, ¿sí? Bien, borrón y cuenta nueva.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Take this one with you and read it.
See you on Friday.
- [in English] Thank you. - [in Norwegian] Bye.
[woman speaking Norwegian on headphones] Hello.
How are you?
Fine. And you?
I have new mittens.
How about you?
[in English] What the fuck?
Little lamb,
what are you doing out here by yourself?
All right. Take it easy.
Take it easy.
- [sheep bleating] - Where you going?
Come here!
[man speaking Norwegian on TV] But in languages,
translation.es: Pero en los idiomas no solo cuenta la lingüística y la investigación.

translation.en: not only linguistics and research are important.
translation.es: no solo cuenta la lingüística y la investigación. ¿Crees que el lobo mató a mi oveja?

translation.en: Do you think the wolf killed my sheep?
translation.es: ¿Crees que el lobo mató a mi oveja?

translation.en: No, Jonas, don't think like that.
Everything will be fine.
I couldn't see any footprints of predators.
Dad?
Do you know anyone who drives an electric car?
translation.es: ¿Conoces a alguien con un auto eléctrico?

translation.en: Hi. Do you need any help?
Uh... Come, come.
[whispers] Put that away.
[in English] I found her on the road and I'm looking for the owner.
translation.es: La encontré en la carretera y busco al dueño.

translation.en: [Sigrid in Norwegian] It is an escaped sheep.
- Hi, I'm Sigrid. - [in English] Oh, hi.
translation.es: Hola, soy Sigrid. -Hola. -No nos saludamos en el tren.

translation.en: We never said hello on the train.
Yeah, yeah. Giovanni. Call me Johnny.
[Sigrid in Norwegian] Now you are happy, Jonas.
You...
Thanks a lot for finding her.
translation.es: Gracias por encontrarla. Un placer. Tuve suerte.

translation.en: [in English] My pleasure. I got lucky.
- That's a nice kid you got there. - Yeah.
Father around? I'd like to meet him.
Uh... No, he's not living here.
Well, small town. Maybe we'll run into each other again, you know?
translation.es: Es un pueblo pequeño. Quizá volvamos a vernos.

translation.en: - Yeah. - Have a little coffee.
Okay. Thank you.
[in Norwegian] Hello. Nice that so many could come.
translation.es: Hola. Qué bueno que vinieran tantos.

translation.en: Eight people. Very good.
Today we are going to have a look at some forms.
translation.es: Hoy vamos a leer unos formularios.

translation.en: You are disturbing us.
What Giovanni is doing here,
is breaking the first rule of the workplace,
translation.es: es violar la primera regla del lugar de trabajo,

translation.en: namely, being punctual.
So, I see there are some regulars here.
That's always nice. Hi, Maria.
translation.es: Eso está muy bien. Hola, María. Si tomaron el seminario de motivación

translation.en: Those among you who were at the motivation seminar
translation.es: Si tomaron el seminario de motivación

translation.en: held at my cabin last year know that I am a fishing enthusiast.
translation.es: que di en mi cabaña el año pasado, saben que soy fanático de la pesca.

translation.en: And what I usually say is that getting a job is like fishing.
translation.es: Y yo digo que conseguir empleo es como pescar.

translation.en: You have to put the line out to catch something.
translation.es: Se tira el anzuelo para pescar algo.

translation.en: It's time for you to meet a friend of mine. Arne.
translation.es: Es hora de que conozcan a un amigo mío: Arne.

translation.en: Today, Arne is your employer, and you are going to a job interview.
translation.es: Hoy Arne será el jefe. Tendrán una entrevista de trabajo.

translation.en: - [Arne] Am I... Sorry. - [Jan] Don't disturb me.
Um... Any volunteers?
Does anyone want to... Giovanni?
[in English] Come on, let's give it a shot. Yes, please.
Thank you.
[in Norwegian] Hi, Giovanni.
Why, exactly should we choose you?
[in English] Do I talk to you or talk to the dummy?
translation.es: ¿Le hablo a usted o al muñeco?

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Talk to Arne.
Hi, Giovanni. Uh... What are your strong qualities?
[in English] My strong qualities? Uh...
I'd say observation's one of my finer qualities.
translation.es: Mi capacidad de observación es una de ellas.

translation.en: Observing you, I'd say you look a little stiff.
translation.es: Lo observo a usted y noto que está algo acartonado.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] You can't have a little fun.
Let's take a little break.
Giovanni, could I have two minutes?
[in English] Two minutes, please.
[in Norwegian] I'm going to transfer you over to a course called Fresh Start.
translation.es: Lo transferiré a un curso llamado Empezar de Cero.

translation.en: [in English] What's that?
It's a six-month daily course
translation.es: Es un curso diario de seis meses

translation.en: for immigrants that struggle to adapt to Norwegian society.
translation.es: para inmigrantes con dificultades de adaptación a la sociedad noruega.

translation.en: Six months? You gotta be joking.
[in Norwegian] I never joke when it comes to integration, Giovanni. You need this.
translation.es: No bromeo cuando se trata de integración. Lo necesita.

translation.en: [in English] Wait a minute. Are you telling me
I gotta spend half a year learning how to be a fucking immigrant?
translation.es: medio año aprendiendo a ser un jodido inmigrante?

translation.en: [in Norwegian] You would perhaps rather have me call the police.
[in English] Do you want me to call the police, then? And tell them about the bribe?
translation.es: ¿Llamo a la policía y les cuento lo del soborno?

translation.en: - Okay. [sighs] - Okay.
Hey, mister.
Do you want to come for a beer? [in Norwegian] A Friday beer?
translation.es: ¿Quiere ir por una cerveza? La de los viernes. Con nosotros.

translation.en: Uh... No, thanks. I gotta pass. It's a big TV night.
translation.es: No, gracias. Paso. Tengo que ver TV.

translation.en: Sure, okay.
On second thought, one drink. What the hell.
translation.es: Pensándolo mejor, un trago. ¿Por qué no?

translation.en: - Sure. Okay. - Yeah.
[in Norwegian] I get 340 kroners a day from NAV to manage.
translation.es: Asistencia Social me da 340 coronas diarias para vivir.

translation.en: How are you going to manage on that?
[in English] I only get 340 kroners per day from NAV.
translation.es: Solo te dan 340 al día. Con eso pagas el celular, la electricidad

translation.en: [in Norwegian] That is going to cover your cell phone and electricity bills
translation.es: Con eso pagas el celular, la electricidad

translation.en: - and food expenses. - You don't have any food expenses.
You know you eat at home every day.
translation.es: Comes en casa todos los días.

translation.en: [stammers] I am talking about the principle.
How can you manage on 340 kroner a day?
I am talking about the system.
We haven't ordered anything.
From that table.
[Roar] You sit here and drink beer every day. [Torgeir] The system is fucked.
translation.es: -Te sientas a beber cerveza diario. -El sistema está jodido.

translation.en: Shut up. Let's throw some darts.
I am not so good at darts.
[in English] Do you want to come play, um...
[in Norwegian] What is it called?
- [in English] Dart? - No. No, thanks.
translation.es: No, gracias. Me quedaré a cuidar la mesa.

translation.en: - I'll stay here and hold the table. - Okay.
translation.es: No, gracias. Me quedaré a cuidar la mesa. Está bien. Espérame. Yo tiro primero.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Wait for me. I'll take the first round.
translation.es: Está bien. Espérame. Yo tiro primero.

translation.en: - [in English] Hi. - Please.
[in Norwegian] Thank you for the champagne.
[in English] Oh, my pleasure.
[in Norwegian] Are you together with friends?
- You don't take... - It's my turn now.
[in English] Friends...
More like business associates.
Okay. So what kind of business is that?
[in Norwegian] Torgeir gets money from NAV.
translation.es: Torgeir recibe dinero de Asistencia Social.

translation.en: - It's that obvious? - Yeah.
I'm not gonna be at NAV too long. I'm just getting some information.
translation.es: Pronto ya no recibiré Asistencia Social. Solo recabo información. Abriré un club nocturno.

translation.en: I'm opening a nightclub, actually.
translation.es: Solo recabo información. Abriré un club nocturno.

translation.en: - Oh, that's nice. - Yeah.
And you? What do you do?
I'm a teacher, you know... [in Norwegian] a Norwegian teacher.
[in English] I used to work in Oslo, but now I hope to get a job here.
translation.es: Trabajaba en Oslo, pero ahora busco ese empleo aquí.

translation.en: But it's not so easy in this... [in Norwegian] county. So, we'll see.
translation.es: Pero no es sencillo en este condado. Ya veremos.

translation.en: Well, there's a lot of new foreigners in town, so maybe they'll be hiring soon.
translation.es: Hay muchos extranjeros aquí, quizá pronto te contraten.

translation.en: To teachers.
[in Norwegian] Yeah. Cheers.
[in Norwegian] Excuse me? Two, uh... beers.
[in English] Nice place you got here.
I used to be in the bar business myself.
[in Norwegian] Well, if you want it, I'll give you a good price.
translation.es: Si lo quiere, se lo vendo a buen precio.

translation.en: I've had enough of the tax man and freezing temperatures.
translation.es: Ya me harté de los impuestos y el frío.

translation.en: [in English] I'm moving to Alicante.
We should talk.
A hundred and fifty.
A hundred and fifty?
[in Norwegian] That's what it costs.
[in English] Sorry, I have to go. Something just happened.
translation.es: Lo siento. Debo irme. Acaba de suceder algo.

translation.en: There's been a wolf on the farm.
translation.es: Pasó un lobo por la granja.

translation.en: - I'll take you. Yeah. - Are you sure?
Uh... Keep it.
- [in Norwegian] It was the wolf. - I know.
[in English] We're gonna get that wolf.
[in Norwegian] I promise.
[Sigrid] Come on, let's go inside.
You'd better turn away, you being a city boy.
translation.es: Es mejor que te vayas. Eres un chico de ciudad.

translation.en: [in English] It's okay.
[Torgeir in Norwegian] The wolves are too bad. What good are they?
translation.es: Los lobos son muy malos. ¿Para qué sirven?

translation.en: We've got trackers and shotguns over at our place if you need them.
translation.es: Tenemos rastreadores y armas en casa si los necesitan. ¿No les dispararon a las cabras del intendente la última vez?

translation.en: Didn't you two shoot one of the mayor's goats last time you went after a wolf?
translation.es: ¿No les dispararon a las cabras del intendente la última vez? -Fue un accidente. -Fue un accidente.

translation.en: - I've told you that before. - You bloody well know it was.
translation.es: -Ya te lo dije. -Lo sabes muy bien.

translation.en: Why are we sitting, talking when we should be out killing this fucking thing?
translation.es: ¿Por qué estamos aquí hablando en vez de estar matándolo? En este país matar a un lobo es peor

translation.en: [in Norwegian] In this country killing a wolf is worse than killing people.
translation.es: En este país matar a un lobo es peor que matar a la gente.

translation.en: [in English] Bullshit. Are you kidding me?
What are we waiting for? I'm telling you right now--
translation.es: ¿Qué esperamos? Les diré algo, no voy a...

translation.en: - [knocking on door] - [Sigrid in Norwegian] Come in.
Good evening.
I heard about the wolf and just wanted to make sure everything was all right.
translation.es: Supe lo del lobo y quise asegurarme de que todo estuviera bien.

translation.en: There wouldn't be anyone thinking of doing anything rash here?
translation.es: Díganme que no piensan hacer algo precipitado.

translation.en: I think perhaps I'll look after this for a couple of days.
translation.es: Creo que guardaré esto un par de días.

translation.en: [in English] Excuse me, but aren't people allowed to defend their own homes in this country?
translation.es: ¿Acaso la gente no tiene derecho a defender su propio hogar en este país?

translation.en: Unlicensed killing of wild animals
translation.es: La matanza no autorizada de animales salvajes

translation.en: is strictly forbidden in Norway.
[in Norwegian] I take it we're all fully aware of that.
Could I have a waffle?
Of course, help yourself.
Thank you, Sigrid.
You're welcome.
Have a nice evening.
[in English] Sorry, Lily.
So, you guys really know how to find this wolf or what?
[in Norwegian] What do you think you're gonna do to it?
Is he gonna back up over it in the lawn mower?
translation.es: ¿Acaso lo atropellará con su cortadora de césped?

translation.en: [in English] You guys in or out?
We're in, but...
Maybe it's a bit dark now.
- [in Norwegian] It's damn cold. - [in English] Yeah, real cold.
translation.es: Hace mucho frío. Sí, hace mucho frío.

translation.en: Oh, I see.
What do you mean, "I see"?
You talk real big, but when it comes down to it, you're chicken.
translation.es: Hablan mucho, pero cuando llega la hora, son unas gallinas.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Is he calling us "chicken"?
[Frank in English] Is this really necessary?
[in Norwegian] You can't be wandering about the woods in patent leather shoes.
translation.es: No puedes ir por el bosque con zapatos de charol.

translation.en: [in English] Just look at the snow.
There's something wrong with these things!
[in Norwegian] Did I see some snowshoes in the barn?
translation.es: ¿Vi zapatos de nieve en el cobertizo?

translation.en: [in Norwegian] The wolf appears to be further north.
translation.es: El lobo parece estar más al norte.

translation.en: Are you sure this is a good idea? You heard what the police chief said.
translation.es: ¿Seguro que es buena idea? Escuchaste lo que dijo la jefa de policía.

translation.en: The police chief? She's home in bed by now.
I'm just a bit worried about striking out off the track
with our new countryman back there.
Since when did you become such a pussy?
Come on.
Check out the tracker. Is he close by or what?
[in Norwegian] You are getting better at it.
[in English] Yeah... Real funny.
[mutters] You fat fuck, you.
[in Norwegian] These are really fresh.
[Frank in English] Could have been in the Bahamas.
Or Fort Lauderdale.
No. I gotta go to a place where if your dick freezes off,
translation.es: No. Tengo que estar aquí donde, si se te congela el pito,

translation.en: you don't even notice it for three days.
translation.es: tardas tres días en darte cuenta.

translation.en: I'm telling ya...
[Roar in Norwegian] What the hell!
Fuck!
Roar...
Sorry! I didn't see you!
I'm blacking out!
- Wait! - [groaning]
- Sorry, fuck! - You hit a main artery.
translation.es: ¡Perdón, maldición! Le diste a una arteria principal.

translation.en: - [gunshot in the distance] - What's happening?
Never mind that. I'm dying here, you fucking idiot.
Bandage me!
Torgeir, you shot me!
It just grazed you. You'll be fine.
- It really hurts. - It just grazed you. Here.
- You shot me, idiot! - Here.
- Do something! - Here.
We just have to stop the little that comes out.
translation.es: Debemos detener lo poco que sale.

translation.en: [Frank in English] Did I hear a shot?
[in Norwegian] Misfire. But it's all right.
[in English] Look what I ran into while you kids were playing cowboys and Indians.
translation.es: Miren qué encontré mientras ustedes juegan a los vaqueros.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Holy shit!
[in English] How about that?
[Torgeir in Norwegian] Fuck!
[in English] One more rock should do it, huh?
translation.es: Una piedra más y ya está, ¿no?

translation.en: [whispering in Norwegian] Shh! What was that?
[whispering] Probably just a deer or something.
translation.es: Seguro un ciervo o algo así.

translation.en: [man in Norwegian] Hello? Anybody there?
[Frank in English] We gotta get out of these woods.
[in Norwegian] I can't walk home on this leg.
translation.es: No puedo caminar con la pierna así.

translation.en: [Torgeir in English] I used to go fishing with NAV here.
translation.es: Pescaba aquí con la Asistencia Social.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Johansen's cabin.
I think it's in that area. We can spend the night there.
translation.es: Creo que está cerca. Podemos pasar la noche allí.

translation.en: [man] What are you doing?
- [Torgeir] Where the hell is the key? - [shuddering]
Fuck.
[in English] I found it.
[Torgeir in Norwegian] I know what we need now.
- Do you have it? - Yes.
- [in English] That's a good idea. - Yeah.
[chuckles] There's booze in that.
Yes, homemade.
That's some Norwegian cuisine I could learn to love.
translation.es: Hay platos noruegos que podrían gustarme.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] I'm hungry.
[in English] You should call room service.
What did you do, um... back in the States?
I had a restaurant, a little bar.
translation.es: Tenía un restaurante, un bar pequeño.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] You seem to know a lot about guns and...
[in English] getting rid of evidence...
[in Norwegian] and pistols for just a restaurant guy.
translation.es: ...de desaparecer evidencia... ...y de pistolas para ser restaurantero.

translation.en: [in English] You kiddin'?
You ever seen the Cooking Channel?
translation.es: ¿No has visto el canal de cocina?

translation.en: It can get pretty rough.
[in Norwegian] What the hell? What the hell?
Any naked ladies?
Yeah.
- [Roar laughs] - Johansen?
- Yeah. - [Roar in Norwegian] Look at him.
[Torgeir] Holy shit! Look at this.
She can't be more than 15, 16 years old.
translation.es: No debe tener más de 15 o 16 años. Seguido las llevaba a ella y a su madre a la escuela.

translation.en: I've driven her and her mom to school several times.
translation.es: Seguido las llevaba a ella y a su madre a la escuela.

translation.en: [Torgeir] He works for the county.
[in English] Yeah, that's interesting.
- [in Norwegian] I am getting sick. - [Torgeir] Look at him!
I am shocked!
This is serious business.
He works for the county.
Roar...
[in English] Look who's here.
Be cool, okay?
Follow my lead.
Oh, hello.
[Laila in English] Hi.
[in Norwegian] Well, been on a long trip?
[in English] Just, uh, out enjoying your lovely scenery.
[in Norwegian] We've had a report about illegal hunting in this area.
translation.es: Recibimos una denuncia de caza ilegal en esta zona.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Wow!
- [in English] Illegal hunting, yeah? - Ah.
That's crazy.
[in Norwegian] We have a witness.
Supervisor Antonsen.
He saw illegal hunting in the Mesna hills yesterday.
translation.es: Ayer vio cazadores ilegales en las colinas de Mesna.

translation.en: If you have something to say, it would be wise to do it now.
translation.es: Si tienen algo que decir, díganlo ahora.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] We were...
[in English] We don't really have anything to say because we didn't see anything.
translation.es: No tenemos nada que decir porque... nosotros no vimos nada.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Did you see these guys yesterday?
- Huh? - No?
The ones I saw were younger fellas.
translation.es: Los que vi eran más jóvenes.

translation.en: [Laila] But you said you saw the Lien brothers.
translation.es: Pero dijo que vio a los hermanos Lien.

translation.en: [Antonsen] My eyesight clearly isn't as good as it used to be.
translation.es: Mi vista no es tan buena como solía ser.

translation.en: [Lailla] Isn't it, now?
The ones I saw must have been some youths from Oslo.
translation.es: Los que vi deben haber sido jóvenes de Oslo.

translation.en: Youths from Oslo are the worst.
translation.es: Los jóvenes de Oslo son los peores.

translation.en: [in English] So, now that we've cleared up that little misunderstanding,
translation.es: Ahora que aclaramos el pequeño malentendido,

translation.en: why don't we all go inside and have a drink?
translation.es: ¿por qué no entramos a tomarnos un trago?

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Thank you, but we'd better be off.
[in English] Always good to help the authorities.
translation.es: Es un placer ayudar a las autoridades.

translation.en: Especially when they're neighbors. [chuckles]
How ya doin'?
[in Norwegian] I don't think we have an appointment today.
translation.es: No sabía que tuviéramos cita hoy.

translation.en: [in English] I think we do.
[in Norwegian] If you think you can come charging in here with more bribes...
translation.es: Si cree que puede venir a ofrecerme más sobornos...

translation.en: [in English] Yeah, well, that's my appointment.
translation.es: Pues... de eso trata la cita.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] What's this?
But how have you got hold of these?
[in English] The real question is, what am I gonna do with them?
translation.es: La pregunta es: "¿Qué haré con ellas?".

translation.en: Is this blackmail?
Definitely.
Where I come from, these kind of pictures could be a problem for a public official,
translation.es: De donde yo vengo, estas fotos serían un problema para un funcionario,

translation.en: but maybe that's just [mocking] cultural differences.
translation.es: pero quizá solo sean diferencias culturales.

translation.en: Could be a problem here as well. Absolutely.
translation.es: Aquí también podrían ser un problema. Sin duda.

translation.en: Okay.
How about I make the pictures disappear and you do a little something for me.
translation.es: Entonces, ¿qué tal si hago desaparecer las fotos y usted hace algo por mí?

translation.en: Is this about the... [in Norwegian] New Start course? [in English] I can get you off, it's no problem.
translation.es: Si se trata del curso Empezar de Cero, puedo evitar que vaya, no hay problema.

translation.en: [in English] Nah.
I'm gonna take that course and this is gonna be my teacher.
translation.es: Quiero tomar el curso, y ella será mi profesora.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] She has been here for some interviews...
[in English] She's not working here, you know.
Is that gonna be a problem?
No, no, no, no, no.
All right.
So now all we gotta do is take care of the license for my sports bar.
translation.es: Ahora solo resta la licencia para mi bar.

translation.en: Yeah, you know, as I said, that's a very complicated...
translation.es: Pues, como le dije, eso es muy complicado...

translation.en: I understand.
Wait, wait, wait, I can... I can call a guy.
translation.es: Espere, espere. Puedo... llamar a alguien.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] I think maybe I have a friend in the Department of Industry...
translation.es: Quizá tenga un amigo en la Secretaría de Industria...

translation.en: [in English] Listen, last time, you mentioned something about financial motivation...
translation.es: La última vez usted habló de motivación financiera, ¿o no?

translation.en: Yeah, I did.
But now, this is all the motivation we need, pally.
translation.es: Pero, ahora, esta es la única motivación que necesitas, amigo.

translation.en: Make that fucking phone call.
Yep.
[Frank] What do you think of this joint?
Looks nice.
Good enough to own?
Of course it's good enough to own. [chuckles]
What do you think?
Well, I bought it.
I need a partner. I'm thinking about you.
translation.es: Necesito un socio. Pensé en ti.

translation.en: Me?
You bought it?
[chuckles] Yep.
Take a look.
[in Norwegian] But how much is this gonna cost me?
Nothing.
You sign at the bottom, then you're a bar owner.
translation.es: Firma abajo y serás dueño del bar.

translation.en: [in Norwegian] Are you kidding?
[in English] You're not shitting me right now?
[in Norwegian] You're the fuckin' classiest immigrant I've met.
translation.es: Eres el inmigrante con más clase que haya visto.

translation.en: [in English] I'll take that as a yes?
You bet your ass it's a yes.
Torgeir Lien.
I'm a bar owner now!
- Congratulations. - Thank you, sir!
Why don't you pour us a little celebration libation?
translation.es: ¿Qué tal si sirves un trago para festejar?

translation.en: Sure, Giovanni.
Look at me, I'm a bar owner!
[in Norwegian] This could be a new start for me, Giovanni.
[in English] Call me Johnny.
translation.es: Llámame Johnny. De acuerdo, te llamaré Johnny.

translation.en: Okay, I'll call you Johnny.
To new beginnings.
New beginnings.
- And early fucking spring. - Yeah.
[Torgeir in English] "To my number one fan, Frank."
[in Norwegian] Who's Frank then?
[in English] Somebody I used to know.
In another life.
[in Norwegian] This is Laila Hovland, chief of police in Lillehammer.
translation.es: Soy Laila Hovland, jefa de policía de Lillehammer.

translation.en: I'd like to run a background check on Giovanni Henriksen.
translation.es: Quiero indagar sobre los antecedentes de Giovanni Henriksen.

translation.en: Giovanni. Yeah.
